content.label: A few games, like Glory of Generals, seem to have far more content for lower prices. This is well produced, but limited for $10. If you plan to play PvP, it could be a great choice. Read some 5 & 1 star reviews before you spend $10.

It's a good game but there are only two missions and you can play one of those for free in the Lite version. Every other mission is an in-app purchase so what did I pay the $10 for in the first place? This is not worth the money.

Too hard to read terrain features, which affect combat outcome. This will make the 
Order folks nostalgic for the Avalon 
Hill games, which this imitates but without 
Cool situational awareness of the 
Board game - instead it's like 
Looking through a soda straw at board.

title.label: A war game for non- war gamers

content.label: I never was into war games. Seemed to tedious. This game keeps the strategy and excitement without getting bogged down into far too many details. There is a lot of depth here, but it's easy enough to play that it gets very fun , quickly. Play a couple of rounds of the Meuse scenario, read the players guide and then enjoy getting close or achieving victory.

Absolutely love this game and have spent hours upon hours on it. I purchased it for the multiplayer as I have a lot of competitive war gaming friends. We are having a blast going head to head in this game. As a history buff I also love the historical accuracy, all the way down to the finest details in-game.
Well designed, historical, amusing, looks good, but, it's too expensive for only one battle... don't buy this, you don't get ten dollars worth

title.label: I love a game that you're destined to lose

content.label:
And still pull off a victory!  I'm not a huge wargamer, but I've played my share of the basic ones. I've played BotB enough now to know this is a smooth game with tons of resources and is different every time. 

I've mostly played as the Germans as the odds are against them and "victory" all the more sweeter.

Never played online, so can't rate on that. 

One bug: I've reached and crossed the Meuse through Liege on two occasions (it's damned hard to do so) and I've been awarded VPs for Dinant when I wasn't even close. While I love a good sauerkraut sandwich in celebration (three panzers to the north to kick that smug beret wearing teetotaler's keister), I'd rather not get the "free" points doing so. 

Excellent over all!
There are better strategy games out there that are more reasonably priced.

title.label: Wealth of strategy packed into a tiny board

content.label: The map doesn't look like much - just 50 or so spaces. But the meticulously developed rules pack a wealth of strategy into that tiny space. The well-researched historical notes are almost with the price alone, too.
Nice game, but for $10 the playability is very limited... Requires significant additional in app purchases for additional missions, ai opponents, etc... Shame on you!
This game is overly complicated and annoying to play

Think of chess except each piece can only move three times before the game is over. It's just way to short and simple of a game. The axis side is extremely limited in how it can win, and must play nearly perfectly to do so.

I was fan of axis&allies table game, and this one reminded me... but after an hour it becomes boring ;( i am dissapointed that there are additional purchases as it is already to expensive.  Also, Gameplay itself is unlogical, each hour you move just one unit, as you have only one soldger driving all tanks ;)

If you are fun of good strategy better spend money on tigris&euphrat or neuroshima, they are 10x more interesting.
Certainly worth $10! Fantastic strategy game!!

title.label: Great strategy, easy to play, really fun

content.label:
Pros: Super easy to learn. Cons: A bit expensive and not a lot of replay since there's really only one battle. 

Reminds me of SSI's great Panzer General PC games. AI is decent, two different personalities per side. Play as Axis or Allied. Worth the money!

As an avid board gamer, I was absolutely thrilled to find this app which carries on the tradition of such great Avalon Hill games as Afrika Korps, et al. Realistic, with no overly unnecessary / chintzy graphics, intuitive, and provided with an excellent AI, this game is a must-have for both serious strategic gamers and those who want to try something a little different. There's a small learning curve, but you'll be surprised how quickly you catch on. I'd give it six stars if I could!
Not worth what I paid. I wish I'd waited for the Lite version to try before I buy.

This is an interesting and well made game, it reminds me of ones I like 10-15 years ago. At $9.99 this is a pricy game for a tabletop with basic animation, but I love this design. The price of the initial game kept me from giving it 5 stars and then seeing there are in app purchases on such a pricey gamekeeper me from giving it even 4 stars. This is honestly a move I'd expect from EA.

title.label: Bought it, played it and regretted it.

content.label: The one space activation per turn is really awful. Having to purchase ai opponents and scenarios is not worth it. I wanted to like it but I wish I had my money back and tried the lite version first.

Let me start off by saying I'm not an expert wargamer. I play this game against the AI sometimes, and also against my boyfriend through Game Center. However, this game has enough variation and complexity to pique a strategy obsession I didn't even know I had. I have played (and love) Axis and Allies 1942 Global (Europe and Pacific) and while this game is different in many ways (and is simpler), Battle of the Bulge will not fail to entertain and delight if you are a fan of AaA. If you have never played any strategy wargames, this game is still very accessible, since the rules are presented in varying formats. Here are just a few of the features I love about this game: player's guide, strategy tips, easy (although complex) rules, attractive and simple UI, and the included history (which makes for very interesting reading). On the whole I love this game. I already own Drive on Moscow and can't wait for Desert Fox/El Al. Worth every penny and then some!

A very good, very accurate turn based WW2 strategy game.  
A few negatives: there isn't any tactical skill or action.  Also, never ever ever attack CCA.  The balancing of units needs work.  CCA is basically indestructible and ridiculous--consistently 3 elite  full strength panzer units will fail against a 2 bar CCA .  The Elsenborn Ridge (spelling) is also almost impregnable.  I just don't believe the balancing is always what they show or above board.  It's like the developers will only allow so much reinventing of the battle and then certain units just won't die so you are stuck on a certain path.  And allied infantry do seem much stronger against armor than appropriate as another reviewer said.  Also, it's not really that replay able.  Sure you will play it a lot for about a week but then it's done cuz you've tried every commander and learned what units can be beat.
Anyway, overall a very good iPad strategy game just annoyed by the balancing.  I will buy the Russian campaign.
This is the best game I've ever played.
I got this game the 1st week it came out when it was 4.99 so im a seasoned player it never gets old cant wait till the nextgame!!

title.label: Excellent Game depending on AI mood

content.label: A thoughtful, well crafted game that strikes a perfect balance between a historical simulation and easy-to-learn playability. Map graphics and context information are outstanding, play structure and sequence flow nearly flawlessly, and the various scenarios allow multiple reiterations of a game that never seems to repeat itself. If only the AI could be more logical and not make some very reckless moves that make winning a bit too easy at times... hence a very good 4 1/2 but not perfect 5 star rating.  Maybe having an option to override some of the bad moves would help... Still, this game sets a new standard and will hopefully continue to evolve towards a flawless 5 rating some day!

This game is really fun, and is really accurate and fun.  The only problem is that in combat, allied forces are a little overpowered, although this might too be realistic, as they were better supplied and equipped than all but the most elite german panzer divisions.  Great, fun, accurate game!!
I love this game so much I just can't stop playing it. I would add one thing and that is Bluetooth multiplayer and hot seat multiplayer. ðŸ˜ƒ

I'm new to the genre, and found out about this development studio while looking into Panzer Corps (PC). It seemed, for a while, that there was a dearth of universal titles comparable to PC. And then there was this title: released in '12 exclusively for iPad and later optimized for all iOS devices. I read about the studio's deliberate, intuitive approach to product development, and its steadfast belief in providing nothing short of a full and complete experience for each purchaser. That experience has been characterized by an elegant simplicity that belies deeper complexitiesâ€”a welcome addition to my collection of apps. I appreciate meticulous and intelligent approaches to gaming and can only hope for the continued success of studios such as this one. Thank you for bringing this sublime experience to both iPhone and iPad. Hopefully all of your future titles will take advantage of both devices as well.

P.S., It would be fantastic if there were cloud saves which would allow one to pick up his/her game from a particular point on a different device (eg, iPhone progress from the day continued on one's iPad upon arriving home).

title.label: Closest thing to a board wargame on iOS

content.label: Truly amazing.  Gives the same feel as pushing counters around the board without the setup time and mess.  Map graphics are stunning.  I spend hours playing this on my frequent airplane trips.

We own a diverse collection of iOS games for iPhone & iPad, and enjoy some pretty solid offerings in both casual play and in-depth material, so know that I don't say this lightly: This is the best iOS game that I have ever played. Now, I do enjoy strategy board-style games and military history, so I'm inclined toward thisâ€¦ but this game balances the limitations and potential of iOS perfectly. Great replay value, too.

I must not be the target demographic for this game.  I like war games but this one totally baffles me.  The presentation is nice but it essentially boils down to making the precisely perfect decision for every single move.  Even if you outnumber the computer 2 to 1 you can count on losing pretty much every battle.  I literally cannot think of a single person I would recommend this game to.

I Kickstarted this game and was happy to see it released.  I played it early on and liked it, but  saw it needed more meat on it's healthy bones.

It is bulking up nicely.  This game is so fun to play, and feels like a stream-lined wargame.  my excitement for the future releases from Shenandoah Studios is sky high.

I bought this after seeing some glowing reviews, many calling this the best wargame on iPad. Well I disagree. It's quite boring and not at all like a proper wargame. Graphically it's nice but there is not much game play there.

I really like this game.  The interface works very well, the rules are very clear and balanced, and the AI seems to be reasonably challenging; enough to keep the game fun through many replays.  Although a pet peeve of mine is when developers don't include all of the content in a pay version of the game, which is the case in this game as well with locked AI personalities and locked maps that you need to purchase.  It would be cooler if you could unlock those locked items by completing challenges in the game in addition to paying.  But oh we'll, I suppose DLC is the world we live in now.  Still a very good game worthy of all 5 stars.  There aren't too many  good games like this out there for those like me that enjoy a good strategy game.

title.label: One of the best games on iPad

content.label: This is just about the best strategy game on iPad.

This game is very well done. I, like a lot of people may have had sticker shock at the price, but I sure don't regret buying it. The gameplay is great, as well as the interface. I have played a long time now and have not seen any bugs. The game is not hard to learn(took just a few minutes), but is not to simple as to make it boring. When you play this game as either the allies or the axis you really do get a feeling for the problems that both sides had during the battle. This is because they did their homework and got it historically correct. Well done!!!!

A perfect 5 for both presentation and wargamey gameplay. May not appeal to the most casual of fans, but for anyone with even a vague interest in strategy, it's hard to beat! Until the sequel comes out later this week, of course...
Best game in App Store, can't wait till the other ones come out
Highly recommended.
veteran wargamer.  love the app. Shenandoah rocks.  can't wait for Moscow and El Alamein.
This is the best wargame app that I have found. I especially like the ability to play others online. It is very easy to do.

title.label: AI needs to go back to the Academy

content.label: I surrounded sixteen German devisions on19th and went on the offensive at dawn the next day playing against Dietrich. The Germans never made it to the Muse. The game (bitter end) concluded with the total annihilation of the German army. I have not bought any personalities, but so far, the AI is disappointing.
At first I thought the AI was not smart enough, but it does keep the game interesting.
I love strategy games. This game gets boring really fast.

Overall a solid fairly accurate game with high playability. The only complaints I have are that Allied infantry units appear more capable against elite German armor (i.e SS Waffen and Panzer Lehr) units than they were in practice.

Without a doubt the best war game for the iPad.....ever.  The UI is fantastic, the online play is flawless, and Shenandoah Studios knows what they're about.  Can't wait for the next games in the series!

title.label: Incredible game, now in 4 inch size!

content.label: Slick, engaging wargame. Easy to get into, clear rules, and loads upon loads of history, equipment stats, anecdotes, and helpful commentary. Get this and see what can be done in the world of tablet war gaming.

A great game, however as a WW2 history buff and an amateur researcher of the Western Front, I feel as though the allies are overpowered. I also feel as though the German infantry is underpowered and not given enough strength pips
This single map has more replay value than every other app I have put together. Really can't wait for the next releases.

title.label: Doesn't work on iPhones using iOS 5

content.label: This sounds like a great game, but I am very disappointed that it crashes when I when run it on my iPhone (using iOS 5.1.1). I've heard to runs fine on iOS 6 and 7. The app opens but crashes whenever I try to start a game against the AI. (pass and play matches seem to work) I hope this issue is fixed soon.
I played a lot of games, including war games and board games. This is one of the best I ever played. Simply Wow!
